dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: That I fuckin met How did she find out? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Don't play dumb here Tom.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: You think I leaked it to her?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Who else?

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: I didn't leak it to her.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Well I know I didn't, so that leaves you.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: What's she know?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: She knows whatever you told her.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: I swear to Jesus I didn't leak it to her Steve. I don't want this story out any more than you do.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Well too late.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: What did she tell you?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: She knows where we met, she knows when we met... she knows you had buffalo fucking wings.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: She has a source?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Yes she has a source.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: And you have no idea who it could be?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Yeah, you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: Well it wasn't me, and for the record I didn't have fucking buffalo wings. It's gotta be some one else.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Did you tell anyone?

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: No. Did you?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: Did you admit to meeting with me?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: Then we stonewall her and she's got nothing.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: She's gonna take the story to Drudge, or Roll Call...shit like that.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: You can't stop her?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: She's trying to blackmail me - wants info about Thompson.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: Then tell her what she wants to know.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: I can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: You can't let this story get out.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna be blackmailed Tom.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: You don't have much of a choice here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: If I tell her about Thompson I gotta tell her he's gonna endorse you guys.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: Then tell her. I can handle it from my side if I start getting calls.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: No fucking way. Paul told her we had Thompson in the bag. It'll make us look like fools.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: You're gonna look like fools anyway when he endorses us.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: I can't do it.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: You're on a sinking ship Steve. Tell her what she wants to know and jump. Come over to our side. We can control this thing. Pause. No answer from STEPHEN.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Steve?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: I Gotta go. Stephen hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOLLY walks in... it's dark in some places... she doesn't anyone at first. She stands there... then from the shadow we hear STEPHEN.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: I'm up here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: (startled) Shit, you scared me. She goes up the next flight of stairs and stands next to on the landing.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Take this. He hands her an envelope.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's almost 1800 bucks... you make the appointment now... today... from a pay phone... I'll take you to the clinic and pick you up... no one else... you understand?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: You take the rest of the money and you buy a ticket home... you can't be here anymore... we can't afford it... not with everything that's gonna happen in the next week. This situation just can't be here.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: You mean I can't be here.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: But I would never tell anyone...

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: I would hope not.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Then why?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: You fucked up, Molly...

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: He and I both fucked up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: But I have a responsibility to him... and more importantly I have a responsibility to this campaign.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: I could go to North Carolina and work on the campaign...

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Molly you've go to wake the fuck up... this is the big leagues... it's mean...and when you make mistakes you lose your right to play. Make the appointment and tell me when and where we have to go. He exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN sits at the desk in front of his laptop. BEN sits the floor surrounded by papers and a laptop. As BEN is talking Stephen is staring blankly at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Listen to this. I got the placement in the Times...this is a match up of hope versus fear. Nine times out of ten the fear candidate tends to be the most experienced...but in our presidential races the least experienced candidate almost always wins. JFK versus Nixon...Carter versus Ford...Bush versus Gore...I like our chances with the new kid on the block, end quote. Thomas Fucking Duffy...he's gotta be having a stroke right now. STEPHEN'S phone buzzes, he picks it up and reads the text It reads: NOON TOMORROW, MOLLY. He sets the phone down...BEN continues talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN sits in his car in the back of the parking lot, waiting... his phone rings. He looks at the caller ID... it's Ida... he sets the phone back down, waits, and sees MOLLY come out of the hotel. She looks around and heads toward Stephen. She gets into the car and they drive off silence.

dialogues.speaker: A BIT LATER
dialogues.text: STEPHEN AND MOLLY drive in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN and MOLLY driving down the street. Stephen drives until he sees the clinic. He stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN stands at the receptionists window and hands the NURSE a clipboard with the forms Molly has filled out. Sh hands him back the yellow copies and he sits down next to MOLLY.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: So just call me when you can leave okay.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: (Looking at the clinic) I hate this shit...

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: I'll be back, this'll all be over...

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Yeah... STEPHEN leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in PAUL'S room. He's lying on the bed, talking on h cell phone. BEN sits at the desk working on a laptop. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Absolutely -there's no question about it .... A knock. PAUL goes to the door, opens it and waves STEPHE in, shutting the door behind him as he enters.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But we've got to think broader strokes here, rethink everything....uh-huh....Yeah, I know how to handle it....Look,Stevie just got here. Can I call you back in a few minutes? ..Okay, bye. (He hangs up) The Governor. We had a good long talk on the way back. He's up to speed with everything.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: How'd he take it?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Better than I thought he would. Still won't take Thompson's endorsement.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Paul-I gotta tell you something.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Ida knows I met with Duffy. PAUL stares at him blankly.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don't know how she found out. Tried to blackmail me. Said she was gonna let the story out if I didn't tell her what happened at your meeting with Thompson.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: So it's gonna hit the papers.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Probably. Yeah. Whoever she takes it to, they're gonna call me for a statement. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. 72. (2)

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I could just deny the whole thing, but if they call Duffy and he admits to it, that could look worse. If I say no comment they won't let up.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: I leaked it to Ida. BEN looks up from his laptop.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: At the event.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: We made a deal.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Paul...they're gonna print that story in the paper tomorrow morning.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: But why? Why would you do that to me? Why would you do that to the campaign.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: The campaign will survive.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Then why would you do that to me?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Makes it easier to let you go.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Why'd you meet with Duffy?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: I made a mistake - a stupid mistake. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: No Stephen. You didn't make a mistake. You made a choice. You called me and left a message to call back...that it was important. But when I did...you said to forget about it. You chose not to tell me. Why did you make that choice?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: I didn't think it was important.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Sure you did. But you went because you were curious, because you were flattered. Because it made you feel special to think Duffy wanted to speak to you instead of me. Because you thought to yourself: maybe I can get something out of this. Because it made you feel big. First campaign I ran tiny little race in Kentucky -state senate seat. Workin for redneck nobody named McGuthrie. Had no money, no staff, no fuckin office. Everyone thought we didn't stand a chance. There's no way we can compete. And about this time, a guy running a congressional campaign a few districts over gives me a call. Says, "I really like what you were able to do for poor ole' Sam. But let's face it, he's a goner, so why don't you come work for me?" What do I do? Well Stephen -this is where you and I are different. I told Sam about the call. And Sam says to me, "Paul, you think this other's guy's got a shot at winning, and he can pay you more than anything I can afford, so if it's what you feel you need to do, then I won't get in your way." So I say, "Sam -you took a chance and hired me when I was even more of nobody than you are, and I'd be damned if I'm gonna jump ship just because the shit hit the fan." We lost the race, but three years later, when Sam decided to run for Governor -who do you think he called? We won that race. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And twenty years later I'm where I am now. (Beat) There's only one thing I value in this world Steve, and that's loyalty. Without it you're nothing and you have no one. And in politics it's the only currency that you can count on. That's why I'm letting you go. Not because you're not good enough. But I value trust over skill. And I don't trust you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Well it really isn't whether you trust me, it's whether the Governor does.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: The Governor knows, he thinks it's the right thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: He does.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: If I were you? I'd get a good night sleep because you're gonna get fucking pounded by calls from the press in the morning... Off of Stephen we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOLLY is sitting in the clinic waiting room, Post-Op. The NURSE comes out with a bag of prescription drugs and instructions.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: These are Vicodin...they're for the pain. You have Ambien...that'll help you sleep...and I threw in a couple of Xanax for the next couple of days. Did the doctor explain there would be some bleeding? Molly nods. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NURSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not much...and it shouldn't last very long. If it does you'll need to call us. Molly just sits there staring.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you have a ride? Molly shakes her head yes.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay...if you need anything you just call the clinic...okay.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: (Nods ) Okay. The NURSE walks back into the office. MOLLY just sits there...by herself. We stay with her for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN is driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOLLY walks outside the clinic and down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the front window we see Molly sitting in a booth making a phone call. There is a TV on the wall, the news plays.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE DIXON
dialogues.text: Yes Mike, Senator Franklin Thompson of North Carolina arrived at the Lunken airfield today igniting rumors of a deal in the works. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE DIXON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The NY times is reporting that Senator Thompson will pledge his three hundred and fifty-six delegates to Senator Pullman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN drives by the clinic, he slows to see if Molly is still there. The clinic is closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOLLY gets out of a cab and walks into the hotel. Under this we hear:

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Hey, where were you today?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: I'm not feeling great Ben...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in front of MOLLY'S door as the scene continues.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You picked a hell of day to call in sick...Jesus...fucking wild day...

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Stephen's off the campaign. Paul fired him. Some fucking set up about loyalty and it looks like Stephen was doubling down with Duffy on the Pullman campaign. I was sitting in the room when Paul told Stephen that he was fired. Stephen said who's gonna take over and Paul said me...and I'm like...easy there soldier...but Stephen goes ape shit then Paul gives the speech about loyalty and then shits on Stephen like I've never seen before...christ...humiliating shit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: When was this?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Molly listen to me...I'm gonna run the campaign under Paul...Stephen is going to Duffy. I just jumped three years ahead...so starting tomorrow morning we go into full damage control and I'm telling you Stephen's going ape shit...he said he's taking everyone down on his way out...Morris, everybody! Phone rings. BEN (CONTвЂ™D) Shit I gotta take this. Do you need anything?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. PULLMAN HEADQUARTERS вЂ”- CINCINNATI - NIGHT STEPHEN enters the offices, staffers look up and recogniz him.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Where's Duffy...

dialogues.speaker: STAFFER 1
dialogues.text: You got an appointment? Stephen keeps walking. Stephen arrives at a medium sized, glass partitioned offi As he looks in, we see Duffy and five or six staffers aro a table. Duffy is holding court, the mood is light. Duffy notices Stephen standing there. Duffy walks Stephen a few doors down to a conference room single staffer is working on a laptop.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: Joe can you excuse us for a minute. The staffer leaves and Duffy closes the door. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not very bright, walking in here...

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: I'm in. I'm coming to work for you.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: A reporter at Roll Call phoned me this afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: I know who leaked it.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Paul.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: You told Paul?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Yeah. I told him we met. He leaked it.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have told him that.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: I felt like I should.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: I've worked with Paul. He gets paranoid.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Obviously.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: So he fired you.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: I quit.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: You're lying to me...come on...

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: I quit! And I can give you everything on Morris. Everything. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can lay out his whole strategy for you.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: I already know his strategy. Paul gave it all to Thompson.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: What if I had something else?

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: You'd do that to Morris? To Paul?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: Revenge makes people unpredictable Steve. I can't have someone who's unpredictable. Who's unstable.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: (Calmly) I'm not unstable.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: If it had been a clean break -if you'd left Morris before this story broke, that'd be one thing. That we could control. But the way it'd look now -Paul fires you and then you come work for us. Looks like we're picking up the scraps. Puts Morris in the drivers seat. I can't have that. We see a shot close on STEPHEN'S clinched fist holding th yellow copies from Molly's clinic visit down by his side. pan up to his face.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: What if I had something big?

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Something big. Something that'll bring Morris down.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: What is it? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: (Shaking his head) Give me the job.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: It's not gonna happen. I'm sorry. Go take a nice long vacation.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're a smart guy Steve. Everything I said yesterday is true. But maybe politics isn't for you.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Politics is my life.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: Do yourself a favor. Get out now while you still can. Go into entertainment, or business, or open a fucking restaurant in Costa Rica - anything. Do what will make you happy. You stay in this business long enough it makes you jaded and cynical.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Like you?

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Just like me.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: You knew I was gonna tell Paul.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: I didn't know. I thought you might, but I didn't know.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: You knew if I told him he'd fire me.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: Thing you gotta know about Paul- he's big on loyalty.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Yeah I got a nice speech on that. You were never gonna hire me. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: Put yourself in my shoes Steve. Your opponent has the best media mind in the country working on his team. What do you try to do? You either try to hire him yourself, or work it so if you can't have him, the other team can't either. This was a win-win situation for me. You work for us -great. Paul doesn't have you. Then again, if Paul fires you and I don't take you -fine - Paul still doesn't have you. Either way I win. The moment I got you to sit down in that chair, I knew I'd won.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: This is my life you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: It's not easy for me to do this sort of thing Steve. Don't think I take any pleasure in it. I'm sorry for you. I really am. Take care of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: STEPHEN pulls into the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN climbs the back stairwell to avoid seeing any of former co-workers. He gets to the fifth floor and walks d the hall towards Molly's room. As he turns the corner he sees a maid's cart in front of her room. The door is half open. As he starts walking towards her door, we see the HOTEL MANAGER come running out of Molly's room, he heads the opposite way towards the elevators...he's fumbling with h walkie-talkie. STEPHEN gets to her room and we see a JANITOR kneeling ov Molly's lifeless body. Stephen steps into the room. He can barely move. He just stands there looking at the situation. The JANITOR is on the phone. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JANITOR
dialogues.text: No ma'am she's not breathing...No nothing... Stephen is looking at Molly...he looks around the room... sees her prescription bottle empty on the bed next to her...he sees her clothes all around the room. JANITOR (CONTвЂ™D) .--I don't know, fifteen minutes...how far away are they? The JANITOR now turns and looks at STEPHEN JANITOR (CONTвЂ™D) Do you know her? STEPHEN nods his head yes. JANITOR (CONTвЂ™D) She's gone. We hear the sound of a distant ambulance. JANITOR goes back to the phone. JANITOR (CONTвЂ™D) Hello...I'm sorry what? Yes I can hear them now... STEPHEN looks down on the bed and sees Molly's phone. He reaches down takes it and slides it in his pocket. Close on STEPHENS face as he stares down at Molly. We hear the ambulance approaching the building

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen comes running out the door. An ambulance has pull up and EMT's are on their way in. Police are also pulling up. Stephen keeps walking - he gets in his car and sits there. Nothing. No emotion. Stephen pulls out his phone and listens to his messages.

dialogues.speaker: PHONE
dialogues.text: You have four new messages and four saved messages. First new message. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Beep.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Uhm...where are you?...it's Uhh...(Crying) it's four something...they're gonna close in a few minutes... Beep.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Stephen, it's Ben...listen ...what the fuck...did Paul lose his mind?...Jesus...what're you gonna do? Call me. Beep.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Stephen I just heard from Ben...please don't do anything fucked up...(She's losing it.) Godamnit you motherfucker pick up the phone! Don't do it you fuck! Beep. We now hear Molly in a very different tone, calmer, maybe even drunk.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm not going away... Beep. Stephen hangs up. We stay on him for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GOVERNOR, PAUL, BEN and the other staffers, sit in fr of a monitor watching a news piece. We now cut to CNN footage in front of a hospital as we he the report continue. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN KING, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The coroner has stated, that based on the evidence found by the police in the hotel room, that this was an accidental overdose, a lethal cocktail of alcohol and prescription drugs. The Cincinnati police chief, Darryl Mathews, has called for a full investigation pending a toxicology report which could take up to two weeks. Just a terrible terrible situation for the former Senator, now DNC Chairman, Jack Stearns and his family. Off the Governor's face we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN and SENATOR THOMPSON are seated on a bench.

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR THOMPSON
dialogues.text: I want on the ticket...you need me on the ticket...and you need my delegates...you could use em before Tuesday. Make a fine story on the Sunday morning news cycle...so I expect to hear from you by noon tomorrow...or I endorse Pullman and take my cabinet seat. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR THOMPSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anything else you want to talk about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're at a press conference - The GOVERNOR, PAUL, BEN, an the rest of the staff, are standing behind the microphone The Governor is making a statement

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS
dialogues.text: The entire staff is in a state of shock. We have sent our condolences to Jack and JoAnna Stearns and their whole family... (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: and of course our hearts go out to them... it's hard to imagine what they're going through... All we know at this point is it appears to be a drug...an accidental prescription overdose. Ida?

dialogues.speaker: IDA
dialogues.text: Is suicide ruled out?

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS
dialogues.text: We have no reason to believe... He looks to Paul.

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don't think we have any of that information yet. Obviously there will be a full investigation. Just wanted to say that our hearts go out...our prayers go out to the entire family...and she was part of our family.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER 5
dialogues.text: Did you know her well Governor?

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS
dialogues.text: Not well. But I did know her, and what I saw was a hard working, young woman, with a great and positive spirit. It's a very sad day in our campaign and a very sad day for the people close to Jack.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER 6
dialogues.text: How long has she interned with you Governor? The Governor looks back at Paul. Paul steps up to the mic

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: She'd only been on the road with us for a few weeks...maybe four I think, I can check.

dialogues.speaker: IDA
dialogues.text: Will you continue with your schedule today? You're set to tour Proctor & Gamble this afternoon. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: We will most certainly stay on schedule. This accident, and we have to assume for now it's an accident, is just simply a tragedy. The work, the schedule won't be altered. It just means that those of us that knew Molly will go about our jobs with a heavy heart. As these questions continue, the Governor's cell phone vibrates. He pulls it from his pocket and reads the name the caller. It reads "Molly." He looks up. Panic starts t set in - the only sounds we hear are his heart beating an the phone vibrating. The Governor looks at each of his staff members. Then he scans around the room looking through the press corps up the back doorway where he locks eyes with Stephen. STEPHEN holds a cell phone to his ear. They stare at each other. Then Stephen hangs up, and the Governor's phone st vibrating. Stephen turns and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN approaches the restaurant - the lights are off. H peers through a window - we hear the door unlock. One of Governor's SECRET SERVICE MEN opens the door. He motions Stephen in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen follows the secret service guy through the dark restaurant - they pass several other secret service guys sitting in booths. They cross towards the back to the kitchen door - STEPHEN enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitchen is small and dimly lit. The Governor is stand behind the center island - hanging pans hide his face.

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS
dialogues.text: It seems you have something you want to talk about.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Does it seem that way? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. 87.

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS
dialogues.text: If you have something...or think you have something you want to get off your chest...

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: What's say I do the talking and you do the listening.

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: As of tomorrow morning there's going to be some changes in your campaign. Paul is out. I will be your senior campaign manager. I'll draft a statement, "we're at a point in the campaign where some changes have to be made etc." You can put your own words in there, you do it better than most.

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS
dialogues.text: And why would I do that?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Because you want to win. Because you broke the only rule in politics. You want to be President, you can start a war, you can lie, you can cheat, you can bankrupt the country, but you can't fuck the interns...they'll get you for that.

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS
dialogues.text: What do you think you have Stephen? A troubled young girl tells you a story.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: A troubled young pregnant girl...

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS
dialogues.text: Is that what she told you?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: ..-Who needed cash for an abortion. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS
dialogues.text: What did you do, give her money? Maybe she just wanted cash and you were the perfect guy to hit up.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Is that your best play?

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS
dialogues.text: You need a job that bad Stephen? You walk in here with your dick in your hand...you've got nothing.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: So how did I get here? You're right Mike, there's nothing. No phone messages, no text, no e- mails, no photos or tapes, and yet I'm standing right here.

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS
dialogues.text: Well go home.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: She left a note. The Governor stands in silence.

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS
dialogues.text: How would you know that?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: I cleaned up your mess. I took her phone and I found her note. They stare at each other in silence. Then:

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS
dialogues.text: I thought it was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: You tell me, you were the last one she called. Note says she was pregnant, said you were going to pay for her abortion...it also said she didn't want to hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS
dialogues.text: Then why would she leave a note that could only do that? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Because she's twenty.

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Paul's gone today. I set a meeting with you and Thompson where you promise him the ticket. You get three hundred and fifty-six pledged delegates, you get North Carolina, and then you take office and make right what so many have made wrong. All the things we both believe in.

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS
dialogues.text: Well I don't believe in extortion...I don't believe in tying myself to you for the next eight years.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Four years, let's not get ahead of ourselves. A long beat. Finally the Governor says:

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS
dialogues.text: What were you doing in her room?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Housekeeping, before you ended up on page one.

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS
dialogues.text: No. You were already fired, you were out. What were you doing in her room?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: I was fixing a situation...I got a call, someone from the hotel thought I could help and called me.

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS
dialogues.text: You were off the campaign, but you thought it was important to come back and fix things? It was your voice on the phone the other night. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. And then: 90. (4)

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were fucking her. What did you do Stephen?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: I loaned her some money and gave her a ride.

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS
dialogues.text: I bet you did.

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's no note.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Okay, there's no note.

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS
dialogues.text: Show it to me.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: You think I brought it here? That's how people get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS
dialogues.text: Okay let's play this out. You're not wearing a wire because everything you've suggested is illegal...and you wouldn't fare well in federal prison. You were fucking her and she told you about her situation. There are no records or conversations between us. And since she's had an abortion, no DNA evidence. So if there's no note, then it's your word against mine. Your word. A fired, disgruntled, employee, or a sitting governor...There's no note.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: It's your call Governor. As the Governor weighs his options we-

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: gl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL is sitting in a barber shop getting his hair cut... BARBER cuts... Paul sits there. The TV is on... a sports show... no one talks. We watch Paul's face as the barber clips the back of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL walks out, starts down the street. As he passes the first corner, he sees the Governor's SUV and the Secret Service SUV both parked on the side of the road. Paul loo at the SUV... then walks up to the window. The window rol down and the GOVERNOR leans his head out.

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS
dialogues.text: Paul you got a minute? We stay outside the car for along time. We hear CHRIS MATHEWS under this shot. We see Paul get out of the SUV a the two SUVs drive off, leaving him standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN'S in a different hotel now. The TV is on.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS MATHEWS
dialogues.text: How much could a big shake up days before the Ohio primary hurt a campaign. I asked Paul Zara how his firing could actually help the candidate. We See STEPHEN, shaving in the bathroom mirror, as he lis to the TV.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: The Governor and I both felt, that in light of some of these changing numbers, it was best to put a new face on the campaign...Stephen is very talented...very smart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a shot of an old church. People are walking up the steps and through the big open doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're at a memorial service for Molly. We see a lot of yo people. PAUL is sitting in the back row. As Molly's fathe JACK STEARNS speaks STEPHEN walks in. He sits in the adjacent row - he and Paul look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: JACK STEARNS
dialogues.text: You always hear people talking about events out of sequence...the order of things. There is no greater grief than a parent laying their child to rest...She was a little girl trying to make it ina very grown up world...a world were every mistake is magnified and she was smart and pretty and so so young. He looks to the PRIEST next to him.

dialogues.speaker: JACK STEARNS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Father, you ask us to accept God's plan, to not question his judgment, with all due respect, I don't accept this judgment. She made the world better, not just for me, but for everyone she touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on the street in front of the church. People are filing out. PAUL is waiting next to STEPHEN'S car as Stev walks up.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: You should hire Jack for a speech writer.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: I'll keep that in mind. Are you here to talk to me? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: No. I'm friends with the family. I got her the internship...known her since she was born.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: The Governor couldn't make the flight?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: He's meeting with Thompson.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Look at you, all grown up with tits and all.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: I learned from the best.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: One day we'll grab a beer and you'll tell me what you had on the Governor that put me out.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: How do you know I didn't have something on you? They both smile.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: You better get going, you've got a campaign to run and I've got offices to go look at.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Farragut North? Paul nods his head.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Nice consultant firm right off of K Street. Paul turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A million a year and nobody to fuck you over. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Sounds relaxing. Paul, without looking back.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Doesn't it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOVERNOR MORRIS with his WIFE and DAUGHTER, stand at the podium just behind Senator Thompson. There are a few hund people in attendance, campaign workers, supporters and pr

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR THOMPSON
dialogues.text: And the right man to lead this great nation of ours in these challenging times and the next President of the United States of America, Governor Mike Morris!...And I ask only one thing, that all of us stand shoulder to shoulder and arm in arm in a united Democratic party. Huge cheers.

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR THOMPSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I strongly urge that the three hundred and fifty-six loyal delegates that I have carried as a badge of honor, throw their support to the Governor. Let's end this primary and get on to the business of 1600 Pennsylvania Ave! More big cheers.

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR THOMPSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you. And God bless the United States of America. Thompson turns and shakes the hand of Governor Morris. Morris steps up to the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the following we hear the Governor's speech. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We see Satellite trucks, press vehicles, police cars, etc At a catering truck we see a pair of hands grab some coff and cookies. This is another young intern, JILL. We follow her across the street and into a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JILL comes through the door. We follow her through the hallways crowded with televisio cables and technicians. She makes her way in to a large reception room, where Stephen is watching Governor Morris give his speech. She hands him a coffee. We cut between The Governor and Stephen watching from the back.

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS
dialogues.text: Thank you Senator Thompson! Well the polls aren't quite closed, but I want to congratulate Senator Pullman...And his Republican constituents on their win here in Ohio. The room explodes in laughter and applause. GOV. MORRIS (CONTвЂ™D) Senator Thompson I am honored to stand here today with you. I am humbled by your kind words, thank you. Ladies and gentlemen, today marks the beginning of a fight between two sets of ideals. Either we're going to move forward or were going to live in the past... Either we're going to lead the world in technology, or we are going to bury our heads in the sand... the sands of Saudi Arabia...the sands of Iraq! Either we're going to let greed and corruption ruin our industries and our shorelines or we are going to take back our country! We are not a nation used to coming in second or third... Cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While the Governor's speech continues we stay close on Stephen as he walks through the crowd. We follow him into Governor Morris's staging area. Four monitors on a table show different network feeds. We watch Stephen roll down his sleeves and button his shirt. ties his tie and puts his jacket on. From the monitors we hear reporters etc. We push in on one of the monitors where DUFFY is being interviewed. As we push in we see STEPHEN cross out of th room. BEN is watching, he looks back and smiles at STEPHE

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: No it's not decisive, we still have several contests and those states are going to want to have their say. It does look like we'll win Ohio...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL MADDOW
dialogues.text: But you must concede that these three hundred and fifty-six delegates put the pledged delegates out of reach. And with word today that the super delegates are breaking three to one for Morris.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: We still have a lot of contests Rachel, Ohio is-

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL MADDOW
dialogues.text: Well then do you have the funds? As we read it-

dialogues.speaker: DUFFY
dialogues.text: (Smiling) Of course we have the funds. We're getting new donations daily... Our new intern, JILL crosses into frame looking down at B

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Hey...Ben...I was told to talk to you. I'm supposed to get a phone...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Right...you're.... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Jill Morris...no relation.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Are you a Bearcat?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: No...I'm from Columbus I'ma Buckeye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shot of STEPHEN walking across the quad towards the gym

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pick up Stephen walking with Ida.

dialogues.speaker: IDA
dialogues.text: You're making me look bad.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: How so?

dialogues.speaker: IDA
dialogues.text: I just filed a story that said you were off the campaign and Thompson was going to Pullman.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: You can't believe everything you read.

dialogues.speaker: IDA
dialogues.text: I want to give you an opportunity to comment on my next story. It says that you delivered Thompson...You got the three hundred and fifty-six delegates, you delivered the nomination. And all you asked in return was Paul's job. Any chance of you confirming that? They approach a security guard standing by a set of doubl doors.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: No press beyond this point...she's press. I'll read about it in the funny papers. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: IDA
dialogues.text: Come on Stephen...aren't we friends anymore?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: You're my best friend Ida. And Stephen walks through the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wide shot of the darkened gymnasium. Stephen sits on a stool in front of a camera lit by a single television lig We're now in tight - One PERSON is putting a mic on Steph while the OTHER is applying make-up. No one speaks. The sound man then puts and earwig into Stephens ear.

dialogues.speaker: SOUND MAN
dialogues.text: You should be able to hear them...do you hear them? We hear the buzzing in his ear of the broadcast from New York.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Yeah I can hear them.

dialogues.speaker: SOUND MAN
dialogues.text: Good, quick mic check can you count to ten for me? Stephen counts to ten. Everyone stands behind the camera. The sound man with his headset on whispers..

dialogues.speaker: SOUND MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They're coming to you in about forty five seconds. We sit in silence staring at Stephens face. Ten seconds - nothing. Twenty seconds - nothing This scene starts to resemble our opening - A dark audito - only a few people doing their individual jobs. Stephen looks at two interns holding clipboards and cell phones. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The FIRST AD is sitting on the floor talking on his heads The CAMERAMAN makes adjustments. A MAN sweeping the gym floor in the distance. They all seem to be staring at him. They probably aren't but he feels it. The enthusiasm and excitement of Stephen has given over to emptiness. The price of winning at all cost. We stay on Stephen's face. We now hear the Governor's speech through Stephen's earwi

dialogues.speaker: GOV. MORRIS
dialogues.text: Senator Thompson I am proud that you have brought integrity back to this election. Because that's what this comes down to, integrity. Who we are. Because how we project ourselves to the rest of the world matters!...Dignity matters!...Integrity matters!...Our future depends on it! Forty seconds - the silence is broken by the SOUND MAN.

dialogues.speaker: SOUND MAN
dialogues.text: Coming to you in five...four...three...two... Through the earwig we hear an JOHN KING.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN KING
dialogues.text: We now have Governor Morris's new senior campaign advisor, Stephen Myers, coming to us from Xavier University where Senator Thompson has just endorsed Governor Morris, essentially ending this primary race. (To Stephen) Stephen, can you give us some insight into how this whole thing unfolded? And before he can answer we:
